intro: Krigia montana, commonly known as the mountain krigia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and produces yellow or white flowers in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Krigia montana is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments.
